info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 12:24PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Routt, southeastern Moffat and north central Rio Blanco Counties through 115 PM MDT... At 1223 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles northeast of Meeker, or 20 miles southwest of Craig, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Craig. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 75 and 108. Colorado 13 between mile markers 51 and 99. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
